prompt: National Mission on Sustainable Agriculture is under:
explanation: National Mission for Sustainable Agriculture is one of the eight missions under the National Action Plan on Climate Change.

prompt: National Mission for Sustaining the Himalayan Ecosystem (NMSHE) is under:
explanation: NMSHE is a mission under NAPCC to conserve and sustain the Himalayan ecosystem, which is vulnerable to climate change.

prompt: India's first Biosphere Reserve to be included in UNESCO list was:
explanation: Nilgiri Biosphere Reserve was the first from India to be included in the UNESCO World Network of Biosphere Reserves.

prompt: Panna Tiger Reserve is in which state?
explanation: Panna Tiger Reserve is in Madhya Pradesh. It was repopulated with tigers after they were poached to local extinction.
Melghat Tiger Reserve is in Maharashtra (Amravati district). It is one of the first tiger reserves in India.
Tadoba-Andhari Tiger Reserve is in Maharashtra (Chandrapur). It is a major tiger reserve with good tiger density.
Nagarhole (Rajiv Gandhi) National Park is in Karnataka. It is part of the Nilgiri Biosphere Reserve and a Tiger Reserve.
Periyar Tiger Reserve is in Kerala. It is known for its lake and wildlife including tigers and elephants.
Anamalai (Indira Gandhi) Tiger Reserve is in Tamil Nadu. It is part of the Western Ghats.
Pakke (Pakhui) Tiger Reserve is in Arunachal Pradesh. It is known for hornbill conservation and other wildlife.
Dampa Tiger Reserve is in Mizoram. It is the largest wildlife sanctuary in the state.
Namdapha National Park is in Arunachal Pradesh. It is a biodiversity hotspot with diverse flora and fauna.
Khangchendzonga National Park is in Sikkim. It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site (mixed criteria) and includes the third highest peak.

prompt: Hemis National Park is known for:
explanation: Hemis National Park in Ladakh is one of the best places to see the snow leopard. It is the largest national park in India.

prompt: Great Himalayan National Park is in:
explanation: Great Himalayan National Park is in Himachal Pradesh (Kullu). It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

prompt: Pin Valley National Park is in:
explanation: Pin Valley National Park is in Himachal Pradesh (Spiti). It is part of the Cold Desert Biosphere Reserve and habitat for snow leopard.
The Rann of Kutch is largely in Gujarat (India). It includes the Great and Little Rann, known for wildlife (e.g. wild ass, flamingos).
Chinnar Wildlife Sanctuary is in Kerala. It is known for the endangered grizzled giant squirrel and dry forest ecosystem.

prompt: Silent Valley National Park is in:
explanation: Silent Valley National Park is in Kerala. It was saved from a hydro project and is a pristine rainforest.
Bhitarkanika in Odisha is known for saltwater crocodiles and mangroves. It is a national park and wildlife sanctuary.
